intro: Soroseris erysimoides, commonly known as the yellow starbursts, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant produces showy yellow ray flowers surrounded by pale yellow disk flowers, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Soroseris erysimoides is often found in open habitats like grasslands and desert scrublands.
